scenarios.description: When user requests customer details with a valid customer ID, then the system should return complete customer information including name, email, phone, and address with HTTP 200 status
When user requests customer details with an invalid customer ID, then the system should return 404 error with message "Customer not found"
When user requests customer with malformed ID format, then the system should return 400 bad request error
When user requests customer without authentication token, then the system should return 401 unauthorized error

matchingRules.pattern: When user requests customer without authentication token, then the system should return 401 unauthorized error

scenarios.description: When user creates a new customer with valid data, then the system should create the customer, return 201 status, include the new customer ID, and save to database
acceptanceCriteria: Response includes newly created customer ID

scenarios.description: When user tries to create customer with missing required fields, then the system should return 400 error with clear validation message
When user tries to create customer with duplicate email, then the system should return 409 conflict error
When user creates customer with invalid email format, then the system should return 400 with validation error
When user updates customer with valid data, then the system should update customer and return updated data
When user tries to update non-existent customer, then the system should return 404 not found error
When user deletes a customer, then the system should soft-delete the customer (GDPR compliance), return 200 status, and mark as deleted in database
acceptanceCriteria: Customer is marked as deleted (soft delete)

scenarios.description: When user tries to delete already deleted customer, then the system should return 410 gone error

matchingRules.pattern: When user tries to delete already deleted customer, then the system should return 410 gone error

matchingRules.pattern: When database connection fails during customer fetch, then the system should return 503 service unavailable, log the error, and attempt retry with exponential backoff

scenarios.description: When database query times out after 5 seconds, then the system should cancel query and return 504 timeout error

matchingRules.pattern: When database query times out after 5 seconds, then the system should cancel query and return 504 timeout error
